title: Nilgiri Leprosy Eradication Scheme NILES
detailsOfAchievement: Nilgiri Leprosy Eradication Scheme (NILES) was established in 1991 as a direct initiative of GLRA India and was registered under society registration act. This was a Leprosy SET project from 1991 to 2006 and from 2006 it started functioning as a TB Treatment Unit till 2011 in Nilgiri District of Tamil Nadu. From 2011, the project shifted its area of operation to Coimbatore district and started disability prevention services among leprosy affected persons. Sustainable Prevention of Disability (SpoD) project is being implemented from February 2012, after obtaining necessary permission from the Director of Public Health and Preventive Medicine, Govt. of Tamil Nadu (RC NO 87/NGO-permission/SH.5/2011 dated 24/09/2011) with the financial support from German Leprosy and TB Relief Association (GLRA), India. The overall objective of the NILES-SPoD Project is to ensure that quality Disability Prevention and Medical Rehabilitation (DPMR) services as per guidelines of Govt. of India are provided through an integrated approach with the support of the general healthcare system. The Project envisages that good quality prevention of disability (POD) services is available in all Primary Health Centers (PHCs) and urban health posts (UHPs) and a system of sustained supervision of POD care and quality programme management is established in the district. The services are rendered for leprosy affected persons in collaboration with the District Leprosy Office, Coimbatore district after conducting sensitization programmes for Government health staff on disability prevention and care. NILES work for benefit of the leprosy affected people by providing quality disability care through Govt. health system in all over Coimbatore district

ngoName: PATHWAY CENTRE FOR REHABILITATION AND EDUCATION FOR MENTALLY RETARDED A Unit of DR D M C TRUST
address: E-76/1, 12TH WEST STREET,KAMARAJ NAGAR,THIRUVANMIYUR,CHENNAI - 600041
title: PATHWAY CENTRE FOR REHABILITATION AND EDUCATION FOR MENTALLY RETARDED A Unit of DR D M C TRUST
detailsOfAchievement: Dr. Dathu Rao Memorial Charitable Trust, Pathway Centre for Rehabilitation and Education of the Mentally Retarded, Chennai, India, is a voluntary, charitable, non-profit organization established in the year 1975. Its purpose is to provide comprehensive care and educational opportunities for mentally handicapped children. Pathway is founded on the philosophy that every individual should be given the opportunity to utilize their potential in order to live with dignity and self respect, regardless of mental or physical limitations. Today over 100 children receive full and FREE care at the live-in facility, while another 300 children are seen on daily basis for rehabilitation and educational programs. During the last 40 years Pathway has served more than 40000 children and adults with various problems and disabilities. Pathway has been commended by the state government as well as the union government for its services to the disabled over these years. It has received considerable awards PAMELA MARTINEZ/PATHWAY Agro farm for children named after its donor is located in a large 65 acre agro farm in Agili, Madhuranthakam Taluk, Kancheepuram District. This agro farm houses a large orphanage to house more than 200 children, a well organized and well run English medium Matriculation Residential school, recognized by the Directorate of Matriculation Schools, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The children are offered high class facilities such as swimming, yoga, music, good recreational facilities, quality education, total medical care. A HOSPITAL ON WHEELS is also run from this facility serving a large number of poor villagers around the Agro farm. SABIN CENTRE FOR EDUCATION AND REHABILITATION OF THE DISABLED was dedicated in November 2009 and has been serving children, adolescents and adults with mental retardation, cerebral palsy, autism and related dysfunctions. This centre has the services of professional and other staff. As a part of Sabin Centre for Disabled the organization has initiated outreach programme to serve disabled in a couple of locations in nearby villages.

title: PEOPLE FOR ANIMALS CHENNAI CHARITABLE TRUST
detailsOfAchievement: In 1995 we shut down the electrocution chamber and put an end to the 72 year old practice where in 20,000 street dogs used to be brutally electrocuted to death by the Corporation of Chennai. We initiated the WHO recommended mass Animal Birth Control Anti rabies Immunization program in our city .Every year since 1995 , an average of 9000 dogs have been sterilised and immunised against rabies and a result of which the incidence of human rabies in Chennai has been nil from 2009.
